Now instead of tilting because I can't get out of Bronze, I'll be tilting because I can't get INTO Bronze.  Oh joy.

The new system is intended to better reflect your skill gains, where before the population (and therefore MMR range) in low ranks was so high, that even a substantial increase in skill was not reflected in rank. Point being, if you're improving, you should really be able to *see* that this season, so even if you start a bit lower than you'd like, you'll have a much better idea of your improvement.

Positional matchmaking will also alleviate a lot of the drama that occurs when players get autofilled.

I'd also strongly recommend focusing on one thing at a time. Look at ranked as a ladder (there's a reason Riot uses that analogy a lot). Instead of placing your metaphorical rungs so far apart (one rung per rank), add rungs between those high points in your climb, it'll make things a lot easier and you'll climb a lot faster. If a rung is unreachable from the one you're on, you're not going to go anywhere.

If your CS could use some work, make that your first rung, then maybe you could put lane pressure, wave management, vision control. Even if you're only making small improvements, they will work towards increasing your overall skill. Set and work towards smaller goals you can achieve *now*, and the big moments will come on their own.
